Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller.commands

Class Command

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.commands.Command
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GamePreparationCommand, GodChoiceCommand, InitialInfoCommand, PlayerCommand
public abstract class Command
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
Command is an abstract class extended by all sort of commands addressed to Controller by clients. Every Command is characterized by a type, the player who sends it (nickname and ID) and the proper message. A Command is used by Clients to communicate with Server. For this reason, this class is Serializable.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • WORKER_FIRST

      public static final java.lang.String WORKER_FIRST
      Workers String representation used by Client to send commands, useful to avoid useless Worker Object serialization. Also, we don't have reference to actual Workers on Client.

      Properties used by the Client to construct a PlayerCommand without the need to have the actual reference to Player and Worker instances.

      See Also:

    • handleCommand

      public abstract void handleCommand​(CommandHandler handler)
      This abstract method handles the command received by Server in the proper way.
      Parameters:
      handler - the object that is going to handle the command

    • parseCellIdentifiers

      protected static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> parseCellIdentifiers​(java.lang.String partialCommand)
      This static method handles the conversion between board's cell identification in the form of "BattleShip" to identification in the form of matrix. For example, "BattleShip" cell "A1" corresponds to (0,0) positions in a matrix, "B3" maps (1,2) and so on...
      Parameters:
      partialCommand - a string that represents a cell in the form "letter" + "number" ("BattleShip" form)
      Returns:
      a map for parameter-cell's position in a matrix
      Throws:
      BadCommandException - if parameter-string does not represent a valid command
